stocktrader

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • stocktrader.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class User
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The User class' main purpose is to stores data the can be accessed through the UserSystem class or the Portfolio class.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public boolean checkPassword(java.lang.String passwordToCheck)
        The purpose of this method is to check passwords, used in login.
        Parameters:
        passwordToCheck - Check if this password is valid.
        Returns:
        Return true if valid.

      • makeOrder

        public void makeOrder(Order order)
        This method is used to add an order by using the portfolio method addOrder.
        Parameters:
        order - Add an order to the User's portfolio.

      • cancelOrder

        public void cancelOrder(Order order)
        This method is similar to makeOrder, but it calls remove Order instead.
        Parameters:
        order - Cancel an order in the user's portfolio.

        This method is used to change a user's password.
        Parameters:
        newpassword - Set the user's password to this new value.

      • getPortfolio

        public Portfolio getPortfolio()
        This method acquires the user's portfolio.
        Returns:
        Get the current user's portfolio.

      • setPortfolio

        public void setPortfolio(Portfolio newportfolio)
        This method sets a user's portfolio to be accessed later.
        Parameters:
        newportfolio - The updated portfolio.

      • checkAdmin

        public boolean checkAdmin()
        This method's purpose is to check if the user is an admin, it is used to determine if a user can access certain functions of the program.
        Returns:
        True if the user is an admin.

      • makeAdmin

        public void makeAdmin()
        This method sets the current user to have administrator permissions.

      • getMoney

        public float getMoney()
        This method gets the money available to the current user.
        Returns:
        The user's current amount of money.
